title: How to Cook Corn on the Cob

steps.headline: Bring a pot of water to boil.
steps.description: Make sure that the pot is big enough to comfortably fit two ears of corn.

steps.headline: Husk the corn.
steps.description: To husk the corn, just grab it at the top of the ear where you see the silks (the dark, hair-like strands) and pull it all the way down the corn.

steps.headline: Rinse the corn.
steps.description: Rinse it under cool water to remove any foreign material.

steps.headline: Add sugar to the boiling water (optional).
steps.description: Add one tablespoon of sugar to the water to slightly sweeten the corn.

steps.headline: Place the corn in the water.
steps.description: Gently lower the corn into the water.

steps.headline: Wait for the water to return to a boil.
steps.description: This should take no more than a minute.

steps.headline: Cook the corn for 5-7 minutes or until it's soft.
steps.description: To test it, place a fork in the corn to see if it's tender while it's boiling.

steps.headline: Remove the corn cobs with tongs.
steps.description: Place the corn on a plate.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Cover the corn with 3 tablespoon (44.4 ml). of butter and season it with salt and pepper to taste.

steps.headline: Husk the corn.
steps.description: To husk the corn, just grab it at the top of the ear where you see the silks (the dark, hair-like strands) and pull it all the way down the corn.

steps.headline: Rinse the corn cobs.
steps.description: Place them in a colander and run cold water over them to remove any dirt.

steps.headline: Rip off a large sheet of aluminum foil.
steps.description: The foil should be big enough to be completely wrapped around the corn.

steps.headline: Coat the sheet of foil with butter.
steps.description: Use a brush to cover the foil with 3 tablespoon (44.4 ml). of melted unsalted butter.

steps.headline: Salt and pepper the butter.
steps.description: Add enough salt and pepper to the butter to suit your tastes.

steps.headline: Wrap the corn in the foil.
Grill it for 10-12 minutes.
Serve.
steps.description: Add more butter, salt, or pepper, if you like.

steps.headline: Preheat your oven to 350ºF (175ºC).
Place two corn ears of corn directly on the oven rack.
Roast them for 25 minutes or until the corn is soft.
steps.description: When they're done, remove them from the oven.

steps.headline: Season the corn.
steps.description: Cover the two corn husks with 3 tablespoon (44.4 ml). of unsalted butter and season them with salt and pepper to taste.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Peel down the husks of corn and use them as a handle when you eat it.

methods.name: Other Ways to Make Corn on the Cob

steps.headline: Microwave corn on the cob.
steps.description: Microwaving corn on the cob can take as little as 90 seconds for each ear of corn.

steps.headline: Make a spicy version of corn on the cob.
steps.description: Make corn on the cob with a variety of unique spices for this tasty dish.

steps.headline: Make Fireman's Corn on the grill.
steps.description: This type of grilled corn is extra browned -- and extra tasty.
